Reviews.Title: “A little Oasis Downtown”
Reviews.Author: irloyal
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. Like all hotels It has it's pro's and con's which I'll try to list, but I think this was a great choice. Pro's 3 to 5 blocks to the heart of Downtown. Great alternative hotle for those meetings at the Sheraton or Hyatt. Nice Pool and Jacuzzi area. Rooms are clean and have plenty of room. Fridge and Microwave in each room. Decent free breakfast. The regular HIE fare, but the hostess keeps it freah and clean. Convenient to Ceiy Center Mall area. Several good restaurants in City Center. A few neat/unique place north of the Hotel too. Cons The hotel is over priced for what you get. The hotel keeps prices close to the Hyatt, Sheraton, Hilton $$ range. They get it because they keep the place neat, tidy and supply a free breakfast and have free parking. No managers welcome package. No beer/wine available at the hotel or take-out nearby. I usually stay at an HIE or Staybridge so I can have a glass of wine and cigar at the pool in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been much better than it was...”
Reviews.Author: Drinab
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. It is a very nice facility. The rooms are extremely clean and very pretty. The lobby is also very nice. A free continental breakfast is available and the menu was not exactly the same the two mornings that I was at the hotel. My biggest complaint was the customer service upon checking into the hotel. It was around 10 o'clock at night when we checked in. Our reservations had been made several weeks prior to our visit and I had confirmed all of our arrangements. When we arrived, there was one person ahead of checking in and only one clerk available to assist everyone. That wasn't a problem, it was kind of late at night and it made sense that there wouldn't be a whole lot of people around to help. When our turn came, I gave the clerk our information. Originally we were supposed to only stay one night and at the last minute we had to add on another night so we had two confirmation numbers. I explained this to the clerk and she insisted that they only had a reservation for one night. She became really snippy with me and kept insisting that there wasn't a second night reserved for us. I reiterated that I had two confirmation numbers two more times. On the third time she finally listened to what I had been telling her. Then she asked for my credit card to keep on file. I understand that this is standard procedure in any hotel in case that any extra charges are made to the room. I explained that our room was being paid for by an outside company and that they had already provided a credit card and I had been told that I wouldn't need to provide one again. She insisted and became snippy with me a second time. In the interest of time I handed over my credit card. She told me that it wasn't a credit card that it was a debit card and I explained again that it was a credit card (that's why the Visa logo is on the card) and she became even snippier. Finally we had our key and were on our way up to the room. Upon entering the room I discovered another problem. We were supposed to have a room with two queen beds as I was traveling with my father. During the check in process I was never told that we had been "upgraded" to a room with a king bed. We needed a room with two beds so as tired as we were headed back down to the lobby to change rooms. Someone else had arrived so we had to wait again. Finally our turn came and we were told that there weren't any other rooms available, the hotel was full. I don't understand, our reservation was for a room with two beds...what happened to our room? I had printed out our reservation and it clearly stated that we had a room with two beds. Why was it changed? She couldn't explain why and at that point it didn't really matter as there wasn't another room available for us. She said that all she could do was offer a roll away bed. We didn't have a choice so we accepted her offer. The kicker was that she said it would take her some time to get it to us as she was the only one on duty. It was now about 10:45 at night. We went back to the room and within 15-20 minutes the roll away bed was delivered. Luckily, it fit in the room. I never raised my voice and I didn't lower myself to her standards and become snippy with her as she had become with me on several occasions that night, but she could tell I was upset because about 5 minutes after the bed was delivered she was back with a "treat" bag. The bag contained chips, cookies, and water. That was nice of her and unnecessary as I am assuming that room mix up wasn't exactly her fault. The roll away bed was very lumpy and uncomfortable. The next day we were switched to a suite with two beds and the staff that we interacted with was much nicer and super friendly. That first night put a really bad taste in my mouth though. I know that I was tired from traveling, but honestly, there is no reason to get snippy with your guests especially when they haven't done anything to you. I'm not sure if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hummmm theres better hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: shan g
Reviews.Content: Room was fine but I had to sleep on the pull out couch.. When I un folded the the couch there were no sheets... I go down to tell the desk lady she handed me a 30 pound bag full of sheets to haul to the 2 nd floor to fix the bed myself.. Then we opened the cabnets to put our stuff in and there was trash from the prior guests.. For a 160 bucks a night I expected a little more.. location was perfect though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StevenGoneTraveln
Reviews.Content: Not sure if it was because I just came off of 4 nights at Motel 6, but I really liked this place, big room, clean, the breakfast was good. Best of all was the location, close to museums, ballparks, and a nice movie/restaurant complex across the street, all for a great price. Will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mike b
Reviews.Content: Right downtown in quieter area close to sports complexes and other sights. Spotless clean, great service, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a VIP, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: quantumleaper1
Reviews.Content: this was my 2nd time at this hotel. Treated with utmost respect. Got upgrades without asking for them. After I checked in this time Elaine who checked me in called my room to welcome me again and asking if I needed anything for my stay. The next am when I awoke I found a hand written note under my door from Elaine again. Again, thanking me for being a customer! I travel a huge amount and very rarely do I find staff who go out of their way to make me feel so welcomed and appreciated as a client. Holiday inn express is my favorite hotel brand. Absolutely best value for the money and staff who actually want to help you and express their gratitude for your pationage. I will be back here and others in this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Good place close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Zbigniew T
Reviews.Content: This was a company trip to a symposium in Phoenix. The property is located a perfect 10 minutes walk from the downtown convention center (with 2 Starbucks along the route). Parking and truly high-speed internet are free/included. Rooms are large and clean, staff is friendly, and breakfast is well above average (also included). This is a perfect alternative to hotels right next to the convention center. We appreciated a discounted rate; the full street rates for rooms are a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like fleas?”
Reviews.Author: Rick S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room that someone must had a pet in before us because all four of us got fleas from the beds while staying here. Pick somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: While on a business/training trip to phoenix, stayed at this hotel. Great location downtown, staff were wonderful and very helpful. Room was great, everything was great. If ever in Phoenix again, would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would have neem great but A/C wasn't great”
Reviews.Author: Rich-Rich1
Reviews.Content: Overall I think this hotel does a great job delivering the solid holiday inn express experience. I liked having a spacious clean room and breakfast spread is always nice. The only complaint I have is my A/c in my room wasn't working that well. I told the staff and they said they had it checked but it still did not cool the room very well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkc007
Reviews.Content: Awesome staff, clean rooms, great breakfast, you get worth of every penny you spend here.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to stay in downtown Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: Hopingtoseetheworld
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and clean. The hotel is very quiet and well maintained. The pool/hot tub area is very nice and open year round. All of the employees from the maids, breakfast personnel, and the front desk representatives were very helpful and amazing. The free breakfast in the morning is very nice and I noticed there were different main dish choices on different days. One day scrambled eggs with sausage, the next day, eggs with cheese(sort of omelet style) with ham. They also have a pancake maker, fruits, pastries, toast, yogurts, biscuits/gravy, assorted juices, milk and coffee. The breakfast is served in a very large room that looks out to the pool area. The hotel is really close to ASU and the Arizona Center (within a short 5 minute walk). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: LutefiskHater
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds and rooms are typical HIE, clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is within walking distance of downtown atteactions, however, if you return to the hotel late at night, be sure you know exactly how walk back to the hotel (or get a pedicab) as the neighborhood can be a bit "sketchy' at night with lots of lonely, off the beated track stretches that may make one concerned for their safety.

Reviews.Title: “More time needed!”
Reviews.Author: Lornznz
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Phoenix after driving down from the Grand Canyon on the way back through to LA. I wish we had had another night at this hotel though. We were a little early but this was no problem and we had our rooms immediately after a little banter about Aussies vs Kiwis. Room was spacious, very clean and had a flat screen TV and fridge. Wifi worked well throughout the stay. We made use of the on site laundry facility also - was great to catch up on some washing. The reception team directed us to the Arizona centre for lunch which was a 10 min walk away where we had several choices for where to dine. We went back later after a swim and spa for tea/dinner to a greek resturant there and had the best time. We had heard that downtown wasn't the safest place to be but we never felt threatened. Breakfast the next morning was awesome with pancakes available and eggs and bacon in addition to the usual cereals and pastries and there was plenty of tables. I just wish we had more time to explore Phoenix a bit more and make more use of the lovely pool and other facilities at this hotel. 2 couples from NZ on a road trip through CA, NV and AZ staying at 2-3 star hotels along the way. Overall this one of the cleanest and most modern feeling of the hotels we stayed at The breakfast was one of the best too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: rtw00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I completed a week trip to Phoenix, Sedona, Flagstaff, the Grand Canyon and Las Vegas. While this Holiday Inn express was not the most elaborate property we stayed in during the trip, it may have been the best value. The room was very clean, up to date and relatively spacious. The bed was possibly the most comfortable sleep during our trip and they also included a nice flat screen tv in the room amongst the amenities. The full continental breakfast was another great perk. To have eggs, pancakes and sausage included as options was a nice surprise. Our stay that evening in Phoenix was largely based on our plan to see a baseball game at Chase Field. This property is a convenient walk to the field or easy drive/cab ride. Our only disappointment came with the city not with the property. Phoenix was nearly deserted for virtually the entire time we were there (ballgame excluded). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this property for a stay. I would just tell you hopefully the weather is more conduscive to bringing excitement and people to the downtown area when you visit. It wasn't there while we were.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. I would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Margee53089
Reviews.Content: Let me say this right off the bat---I HATE TO TRAVEL!!! I freak out when I see a hair in a hotel bathroom, I check the mattresses for bed bugs...I am a spaz! That being said, this hotel is a great hotel! Check in was supposed to be at 2:00 but we flew in from Milwaukee at 10:00 and had to go to the hospital to see my ill relative. I called the hotel from the airport to ask if we could check in early and the lady at the desk was super friendly and said it would be no problem. We took a cab there (about 15 minute ride) and were greated by the lady I spoke with on the phone and she got us right into our rooms. I went over my room with a fine toothed comb and it passed the test! The room was clean, cool (it was 112 outside) and had a view of the pool area. For the price (I think it was $85 a night) it was amazing!!! We wanted to grab some lunch before we went to the hospital so we went back to the lobby and were directed to a really nice shopping center/business area a block away. We were able to walk down there and found numerous choices. After lunch, we asked the hotel desk lady if we should take a bus or a cab to the hospital and she recommended the cab and called one for us. The hotel was very quiet at night. I slept like a rock The hotel offered a free continental breakfast which offered pancakes, bagels, cereal, eggs, sausage, yogurt, etc. The decaf coffee was great. The pool was clean and had ample chairs and seating. There was also a hot tub Needless to say, I would gladly stay there again. The only thing that would make it better would be a shuttle to the airport, but it probably would increase the price

Reviews.Title: “Great, Conveniently-Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Addie314
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this hotel, and I had a great experience. This hotel is conveniently located, and easily walkable to many places downtown. The front desk staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The lady working in the breakfast area was probably the nicest individual I've ever met (seriously!). The pool, hot tub, and workout facilities were always clean. Breakfast was great, with some slight variation each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: 55JT
Reviews.Content: Had a King suite for 4 nights and it was great in all aspects. Attentive staff, good breakfast, free parking and nice (small) pool. Shower was fantastic! Lot of pressure and torrents of water. A good 3-4 block hoof to the convention center but lots of "park like settings" to cut through. The Arizona Center is 2 blocks away. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Efficient, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BontragerAK
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Holiday Inn Express Phoenix Downtown with my co- coach and our volleyball team during the Volleyball Festival June 21 - 28, 2011. Vanessa greeted us with a friendly smile and lots of energy. She had everything set up for us, so check in was nearly instant. She set the tone for the week. From that moment on, it seemed that we were the number one priority for anyone on the staff that we had the pleasure of talking with. The cook was more attentive than a waiter at a four star restaurant. Breakfast was basic, but tasty and nutritious, with scrambled eggs and meat available every day. The housekeeping staff was friendly and efficient; the rooms were clean and comfortable. The front desk staff was always on top of everything. When the night person said they would let the morning person know what we wanted, they meant it. The location was perfect for us. We spent the majority of our time at the convention center, just a 10 minute walk away. Five minutes will get you to the Arizona Center with a nice variety of good restaurants. The immediate area felt safe. I did not have to worry about my players' safety while walking them to and from volleyball and restaurants. The team enjoyed the swimming pool and spa once the sun went down (it reached 115 degrees one day). The property is fenced. In all, our stay could not have been better. If you are looking for affordable lodging in the downtown Phoenix area, give Vanessa a call at the Holiday inn Express Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best HI Express we've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Trajan_Nero
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully clean & new. Great location for ballpark & convention centre and just 10 mins from airport. Fabulous service, lovely pool, excellent breakfast....shame the room was $40 more than I would have liked. Definitely where we'll stay next time we're in Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “Have to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rolanc
Reviews.Content: I am a holiday inn employee from Michigan. We stayed four nights at this holiday inn and the experience was great. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. You are right in downtown and my wife and daughter and I enjoyed walking around the city. I would recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, needs maintenance of a few things”
Reviews.Author: mystique85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. On the positive side, it's walking distance to the convention center, quiet area, and very friendly staff. On the negative side, the toilet smelled bad, even though very clean. It seemed to need maintenance of the sewage system. The walls were actually very thin, I could hear everything around my room, which was a bit disturbing. I would stay there again, but hope they work out these little things.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD location”
Reviews.Author: Highlander65
Reviews.Content: Simple clean Holiday Inn room, breakfast was included in the room rate however it consisted of self help pre-packaged food. Which in the context of the hotel was fine. Room was clean, front desk staff were very friendly, one even walked us outside to show us the direction to town. The location would be hard to beat for down town Phoenix, we enjoyed being able to walk into town for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Executive Suites”
Reviews.Author: cpjlaj
Reviews.Content: Although this location says downtown Phoenix, it's really not deep into the downtown atmosphere, more like on the outskirts of downtown. There was a lot of room around this Holiday Inn Express and we found it to be quite comfortable and quiet. We choose the Executive King Suite, which is actually two large rooms separated by a door, with a sofa sleeper in the living area. The bathroom was also quite large with a large jacuzzi tub. My only complaint was that we had an early morning flight, and the breakfast room did not open until 7:00 A.M. I've stayed in other hotels with free breakfast service that have a minimal amount of food available for those who need to checkout before the breakfast bar opens.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: af02478
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 5 nights while at a conference and for another night with my family. The staff was friendly and helpful. The internet connection was fast. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was typical for this chain. The location is convenient. The Arizona Center, convention center, and ball park are all fairly easy walks. The immediate surroundings are empty. My impression was that buildings were removed for projects that are on hold. I was nervous walking around the first night but in the end felt safe between there and the Arizona Center. The kids, especially, enjoyed the pool. It was clean and not crowded. I would recommend this hotel for business and for families heading to a Diamondbacks game.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the area”
Reviews.Author: tmc71162
Reviews.Content: We went to a night game. Walk took about 10 mins. No problem walking to the park, but walking home was a little scary. Lots of police around stadium but after walking several blocks the scene changed a bit. Hotel is located past a few large parking garages and office buildings and near a construction site. Breakfast was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: doozie123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. On the positive side we liked room size, flat screen tv, comfortable beds, nice shower head, pleasant staff, nice pool/cabana/jacuzzi, 1 block from Arizona Center (shops and restaurants) and a great complimentary breakfast (eggs, biscuits, gravy, sausage etc). On negative side hotel was outskirts of town (but near x-pressway0 , the area felt abandoned (empty parking alot across the street), the toilet was loud, we could hear conversation going on below our hotel room near the pool, and I could hear my neighbors shower/toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: drummerhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Phoenix Downtown for four nights in March as I was there for a conference. Close to the Convention Centre and other downtown attrations. Close to I-10 and access to the other freeways. Parking was free at the hotel and the breakfast was typical for a Holiday Inn Express. A previous reviewer commented on the noise and I agree - the walls are awfully 'thin'. Overall, a good stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for any of the sports events nearby”
Reviews.Author: deano_88
Reviews.Content: Found the Holiday Inn to be a fantastic hotel. Our flight had been cancelled so had to stay in Phoenix for 4 days. Checked into the holiday inn by chance. It is in a fantastic location, a 5 minute walk from downtown Phoenix (U.S Airways centre and Chase Field). Lovely breakfast pool and little basketball court. Friendly staff, good air con. Fridge in room, microwave. Even a little food section frozen pizza's ready meals. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - ok Location”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now, and it seems to get better each time. I had one of their "Suite" rooms this time, which basically is just a larger room with a couch, wet-bar, microwave & fridge. For me and my husband, it was perfect. I arrived quite early (930a) and they had my room ready for me and the check in process took less than a minute (Priority Club Gold member). The gentleman at the front desk was SO nice and seemed to enjoy his job. The breakfast was up to standard for Express. Eggs, cinnamon rolls, biscuit & gravy, cereal, juice, etc. I couldn't have been more happy . The neighborhood is still not the best, but it is so close to everything, it didn't matter. If you are going to Phoenix, stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WandaJoyGlobeAZ
Reviews.Content: Noisy .... could here the guests next door acutally hang their garments in their closet. Heard their conversation after they returned from their evening out along with constant slaming doors from inconsiderate guests; noisy, noisy, noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard Holiday Inn Express...”
Reviews.Author: London_Andy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night when flying out of Phoenix the following day. Very much the standard Holiday Inn Express – free parking, good rooms (complete with microwave and fridge) and of course the breakfast which will last you until dinner! There was also the swimming pool which, although not large, was very welcome given how hot it is (I know – it is Arizona!). Too hot to walk around much, but we did go to the nearby shopping centre and cinema. I’d also recommend a visit to the State House.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Quiet, Close to Chase Field”
Reviews.Author: baseballjunkie
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chase Field with my son for the Arizona Diamondbacks and found this hotel to be very convenient and close to Chase Field and just minutes from Sky Harbor (PHX). I was a little concerned about the neighborhood. Looked like a tough part of town just off the hotel property. Make sure that you do not leave any valuables in your car overnight. The hotel staff was great and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would stay here again if attending any event downtown at the field or convention center. We only stayed overnight and did not really get a chance to check any of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Josbob
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a downtown hotel and the reviews on tripadvisor were OK. The Holiday Inn Express appeared to be adequate. Mainly a business hotel with good spatious rooms, a fine bed and free internetaccess. Location perfect for downtown. Close to the ballpark and musea. So nothing wrong, but rather standard. 220 dollars per night however is really high for this kind of hotel. That's why overall rating average.

Reviews.Title: “A whole lot walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: stevenwsmithii
Reviews.Content: I came out to the Phoenix area for business. When you stay downtown, you are always going againsn't traffic, not in it. I came in the summer so I scheduled my trip where I could walk to Chase Field. it was a very short walk away. Also, there is a mall with lots of restaurants really close along with the convention center and American Airlines Center. A must stay at a great price if you want to to walk instead of drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the Downtown Area !”
Reviews.Author: luvahotvaca
Reviews.Content: My business partner were visiting Downtown Phoenix for a Convention. I booked the Holiday Inn based on price and location. Plus the pictures looked really nice. Overall I was very pleased ! It was a nice 4 block walk to the Convention Center, the hotel was Clean and the service was Execllent! I loved the breakfast they changed the selection daily. Even better they would bake FRESH COOKIES, and set them out in the evening. Our flight left late in the afternoon and they held our bags for us, which was great since we had a convention still going on that day ! We did not use the pool however it looked nice. Our convention pushed for us to stay at the Wyndham since it was only 1 block away. However I do not mind the exercise and this hotel was way more affordable plus and breakfast !!! I am sure I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for ballgames”
Reviews.Author: TwoByTwo
Reviews.Content: We chose this property because of its proximity to Chase Field. In cooler weather the ten minute walk to the ballpark is pleasant, but in the heat of summer it's too bad they don't offer a shuttle service. Other than this small omission, we really enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious and well appointed. Breakfast was typical. Overall, a good value and we would return without question.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at HI Express”
Reviews.Author: raginasian238
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the rooms were large (complete with miocrowave and fridge), and the staff was friendly. Complimentary parking was a plus. The hotel was within walking distance to Chase Field, as well as all the other downtown attractions. It's also conveniently located right off I-10. There are multiple restaurants, bars, gas stations, and fast food places nearby. Once again, I had a lovely experience at a HI Express!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean Hotel with Value”
Reviews.Author: BurbzGuy
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for business in April and needed a hotel in this general vicinity. The hotel is in a decent area. The main walking areas are a 5-10 minute walk away. The lobby was very clean and the receptionist was very pleasant and quick. I was checked in and up in my room in a matter of minutes. The room was very clean. It is bright without being obnoxious. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. All the amenities were working well with the exception of the internet which tended to cut in and out. I did not try out the pool or exercise facilities, but everything I saw was very clean. Obviously it's not a 5-star hotel, but an above average Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Walk to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a seminar hosted at the Wyndham. The Wyndham wanted almost $200 per night, so I picked the Holiday Inn Express. It turns out that for a 4 day trip, I put less than 8 miles on my rental car. Everything was within walking distance of the hotel. I had dinner each night at the Arizona Center, lunches downtown. It was about a 15 minute walk to the Wyndham and felt very safe. The hotel was clean and comfortable with nice LCD HD television set. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: ocshannon
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at this hotel and we weren't expecting much because of the low price. WOW, we were so impressed. The room was spotless and spacious. We had our children with us and they had space to play and we weren't concerned with dirty floors etc. Also, the beds were very comfortable and the bedding was above average. Check in was a breeze and warm cookies were waiting for us at the desk. we had a refrigerator and a microwave. It was an excellent stay....highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Lady Luck.”
Reviews.Author: cottonwoodnative
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean. They are also comfortable, unless you happen to get one facing the construction site that continues through the night. The complimentary breakfast is better than most, but offers the same choices each day. Finding a parking space in front of hotel can be tricky, and there are only two handicapped parking spaces. Staff made several mistakes before my reservation was correctly booked, but were otherwise courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: rulesinjax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on September 24, 2007. The staff was very helpful and check-in was quick. Even though the hotel offers a large continental breakfast in the morning we had to leave early to catch an early flight. The hotel is a short drive to the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport; we didn't have to get on the interstate to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Construction going on all around this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tappy Feet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is being upgraded so construction is going on at present. Also, there is so much construction going on around the site that it's not pleasant sitting around the tiny little pool. The pool deck is so small that one subed almost reaches into the water. The room was spacious and clean. It had a microwave and fridge. There are numerous TV channels and it seems to be used a lot by business travellers rather than tourists like us. We visited the Frank Lloyd-Wright house which was indeed worth the trip. We also shopped at Arizona Mills Mall. There is another HIE right beside the Mall and that location would suit toursits better. We also visited the cinema there and ate at Carrabas nearby. The breakfast was pleasant and regularly filled up by staff. We found the location difficult to find as 6th Street is not on a major junction with traffic lights. If you don't know the area you need to look for a right turn from the Interstate. Once we saw the sign we were OK. As a tourist, I wouldn't stay here again as there are better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: justmewonderinginyuma
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip. Upon check in, the front desk was very helpful in suggesting dinner ideas. It's within walking distance so that was nice. The room was very clean. The breakfast was really nice. Quaint breakfast area. The lobby is really nice. Warm cookies were waiting at the lobby desk upon arrival! USA Today was waiting for me to read during breakfast. I was very happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with every detail”
Reviews.Author: Hidntreshr
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this hotel (two rooms, one suite). I'm using their free internet (available in every room) and INCREDIBLY impressed with this hotel. For the price, the rooms are extremely spacious. Amazing clean. The staff is very friendly. We were strangely locked out of our bathroom and they came immediately. The decor in the bathroom is very modern. Washing machines are available. Free cookies in the lobby. Free continental breakfast. The pool outside is comfortable and warm...a perfect place to spend an afternoon. The whirlpool is great (though there seemed to be excess chemicals). The fitness center is a tiny closet (I would definitely suggest running outside instead). The location is within walking distance to all of the quaint shops and delicious restaurants downtown. I would definitely stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Phoenix Downtown
